revised_title: Determination of the Difference of Meridians of Royal Observatories
tldr: This paper describes a series of observations made in 1825 to determine the difference in meridians between the Royal Observatories of Greenwich and Paris. The observations involved the use of signals, such as explosions of gunpowder, and were conducted by British and French teams. The final result found the difference in longitude between the two observatories to be 9° 21' 1 6, with a high degree of accuracy.
